newsitem.title: USA: Koll/Colony to recapitalize Santa Anita.
newsitem.headline: Koll/Colony to recapitalize Santa Anita.

text.p: Koll Arcadia Investors and Colony Capital Inc said Monday they had proposed to recapitalize the Santa Anita Cos, a real estate investment trust.
Koll and Colony said they would provide up to $27 in cash to shareholders of Santa Anita, which is based in Arcadia, California.
Koll, an investment partnership composed of principals of the Koll Cos and equity fund Apollo Real Estate Investors II LP, had made a previous recapitalization offer.

It and Colony, which joined Koll in its revised proposal, said they would contribute an aggregate of $116.5 million in new equity capital and have Santa Anita distribute a special dividend of $11 per share to shareholders from the proceeds of new financing.

They said they would use about $61.5 million of the amount to fund a self-tender for 5.6 million SAR shares in which existing shareholders would be given the option to receive $16 in cash (in addition to the $11 per share special dividend) for each share acquired in the tender, or $11 in cash plus a warrant valued at $5.
Investment fund Gotham Partners LP will act as a stand-by purchaser to acquire warrants from the companies for stockholders choosing the cash option, they added.

Koll and Colony said their proposal would result in the distribution of more than $230 million to Santa Anita stockholders. They said they would own about 70 percent of the recapitalized companies and receive a majority of the seats on the boards of directors.
Colony Capital Inc is a Los Angeles investment firm that invests on behalf of Colony Investors II LP, an equity fund. Colony owns about 8.0 percent of the paired stock of Santa Anita.

Koll, which owns 8.7 percent in the companies, had made a previous offer to give Santa Anita shareholders $27 a share and provide the racetrack and real estate firm about $91.5 million in equity, according to a report from the financial daily newspaper The Wall Street Journal.
